de.mrapp.android.util.view

Class HeaderAndFooterGridView

  • java.lang.Object
    • GridView
      • de.mrapp.android.util.view.HeaderAndFooterGridView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpandableGridView

    public class HeaderAndFooterGridView
extends GridView
    A grid view, which can contain multiple fixed views as headers and footers.
    Since:
    1.6.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  HeaderAndFooterGridView.FullWidthContainer
      A layout, which is used as a container for a single child view.
      protected class  HeaderAndFooterGridView.PlaceholderView
      An invisible view, which is used as a placeholder.

      • HeaderAndFooterGridView

        public HeaderAndFooterGridView(@NonNull
                               Context context,
                               @Nullable
                               AttributeSet attributeSet,
                               @AttrRes
                               int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new grid view, which can contain multiple fixed views as headers and footers.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • HeaderAndFooterGridView

        public HeaderAndFooterGridView(@NonNull
                               Context context,
                               @Nullable
                               AttributeSet attributeSet,
                               int defaultStyle,
                               @StyleRes
                               int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new grid view, which can contain multiple fixed views as headers and footers.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes should be obtained
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the view, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • inflatePlaceholderView

        @NonNull
protected final View inflatePlaceholderView(@Nullable
                                                     View convertView,
                                                     int height)
        Inflates an invisible placeholder view with a specific height.
        Parameters:
        convertView - The old view to reuse, if possible, as an instance of the class View or null, if no view to reuse is available.
        height - The height, which should be used, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The view, which has been inflated, as an instance of the class View

      • getViewHeight

        protected final int getViewHeight(@NonNull
                                  ListAdapter adapter,
                                  int position)
        Returns the height of the view, which corresponds to a specific position of an adapter.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter as an instance of the type ListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        position - The position of the view, whose height should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The height of the view, which corresponds to the given position, in pixels as an Integer value

      • getColumnWidthCompatible

        protected final int getColumnWidthCompatible()
        Returns the width of the grid view's columns by either using the getColumnWidth-method on devices with API level 16 or greater, or via reflection on older devices.
        Returns:
        The width of the grid view's columns in pixels as an Integer value or -1, if the layout is pending

      • getNumColumnsCompatible

        protected final int getNumColumnsCompatible()
        Returns the number of the grid view's columns by either using the getNumColumns-method on devices with API level 11 or greater, or via reflection on older devices.
        Returns:
        The number of the grid view's columns as an Integer value or #AUTO_FIT, if the layout is pending

      • addHeaderView

        public final void addHeaderView(@NonNull
                                View view)
        Adds a fixed view to appear at the top of the grid view. If this method is called more than once, the views will appear in the order they were added.
        Parameters:
        view - The header view, which should be added, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • addHeaderView

        public final void addHeaderView(@NonNull
                                View view,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.Object data,
                                boolean selectable)
        Adds a fixed view to appear at the top of the grid view. If this method is called more than once, the views will appear in the order they were added.
        Parameters:
        view - The header view, which should be added, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        data - The data, which should be associated with the header view, as an instance of the class Object, or null, if no data should be associated with the view
        selectable - True, if the header view should be selectable, false otherwise

      • removeHeaderView

        public final void removeHeaderView(@NonNull
                                   View view)
        Removes a previously added header view.
        Parameters:
        view - The header view, which should be removed, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

        public final int getHeaderViewsCount()
        Returns the number of header views in the grid view.
        Returns:
        The number of header views as an Integer value

      • addFooterView

        public final void addFooterView(@NonNull
                                View view)
        Adds a fixed view to appear at the bottom of the grid view. If this method is called more than once, the views will appear in the order they were added.
        Parameters:
        view - The footer view, which should be added, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • addFooterView

        public final void addFooterView(@NonNull
                                View view,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.Object data,
                                boolean selectable)
        Adds a fixed view to appear at the bottom of the grid view. If this method is called more than once, the views will appear in the order they were added.
        Parameters:
        view - The footer view, which should be added, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        data - The data, which should be associated with the footer view, as an instance of the class Object, or null, if no data should be associated with the view
        selectable - True, if the footer view should be selectable, false otherwise
